editions.flavor: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

name: Flare
text:
Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.

—"Love Song of Night and Day"

"I strive for elegance and speed in my work."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Flaring Flame-Kin

name: Flash
text: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.

name: Flash Conscription
text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. If {W} was spent to cast Flash Conscription, the creature gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain that much life" until end of turn.

text: Counter target instant spell.

name: Fleshgrafter

name: Flourishing Defenses
text: Whenever a -1/-1 counter is placed on a creature, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: Many horrors take the bait of brave elf volunteers walking alone, only to fall to the blades of rescuers lurking nearby.

name: Flowering Field
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."

editions.flavor: Some lands are soothing, and their peace can be felt in the soul.

name: Flowering Lumberknot
text: Flowering Lumberknot can't attack or block unless it's paired with a creature with soulbond.

editions.flavor:
"It used to eat us trappers. Now it follows us around like some kind of hound dog."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Flow of Ideas
text: Draw a card for each Island you control.

editions.flavor:
"Beware the merrows, whose envy and covetousness surpasses even that of the ravenous whirlpools where they dwell."
—The Book of Other Folk

"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Flow of Maggots
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Flow of Maggots can't be blocked by non-Wall creatures.

editions.flavor:
"The very earth seemed alive and made a sound like the writhing of the damned."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Flowstone Armor
text:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 for as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.

name: Flowstone Blade
text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem

"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn

"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Flowstone Channeler
text: {1}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: With the evincars gone, flowstone became erratic and wild, a source of power for mages more desperate than wise.

name: Flowstone Charger
text: Whenever Flowstone Charger attacks, it gets +3/-3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A mane of flowstone and a mien of fury.
